analyzed: c anvayam āpādayati
translated: He [Dharmakīrti] implies the positive concomitance.

original: pratiṣedhaniṣedhasya vidhānarūpatvāt /🔽asataḥ sapakṣān na nivṛttir ity asapakṣa eva nāstīti cet /
analyzed: pratiṣedha niṣedhasya vidhāna rūpa tvāt  asataḥ sapakṣāt na nivṛttiḥ iti a sapakṣaḥ eva na asti iti ced
translated: Because the negation of negation has the form of an affirmation.🔽If it is argued that since there is no exclusion of the non-existent from the similar instance, it does not exist in the dissimilar instance alone,

original: neti saiva nivṛtter nirvṛttiḥ asataḥ katham iṣṭā /
analyzed: na iti sā eva nivṛtteḥ nirvṛttiḥ asataḥ katham iṣṭā
translated: how is that exclusion of non-existence of the non-existent accepted?

analyzed: abhāva pratiṣedhaḥ hi
translated: For the negation of non-existence is existence.

analyzed: satī api asti
translated: It exists even if it is non-existent.

original: bhāvapratiṣedhas tu na saṃbhavatīty askhalitaprajño devānāṃpriyo yas tadviṣayaṃ pratiṣedhaṃ necchati /
analyzed: bhāva pratiṣedhaḥ tu na saṃbhavati iti a skhalita prajñaḥ devānām priyaḥ yaḥ tad viṣayam pratiṣedham na icchati
translated: But the negation of existence is not possible. Therefore, the beloved of the gods with unerring wisdom does not accept a negation that has that [existence] as its object.

analyzed: asat abhāvaḥ iti ca vyavaharati
translated: And he speaks of non-existence as non-existence.

analyzed: nirloṭhitaḥ ca ayam sati nāstitā iti
translated: And this meaning has been thoroughly examined: In the non-existent, there is no non-existence.

analyzed: artha antare
translated: In another meaning.

analyzed: tena na iha pratanyate
translated: Therefore, it is not elaborated here.

original: na cāsann ātmā sattāsādhanavṛtteḥ sandigdhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: na ca asān ātmā sattā sādhana vṛtteḥ sandigdhaḥ syāt
translated: And the non-existent self would not be doubtful due to the operation of the means of establishing existence.

analyzed: na ca pareṇa tathā upagataḥ iti
translated: And it is not accepted by the opponent in that way.

analyzed: apramāṇāt abhyupagamāt tathā eva bhavati
translated: It becomes so only from the acceptance based on non-valid cognition.

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because of over-extension.

original: na copagamabalena sapakṣāsapakṣau vyavasthāpya pramāṇapravartanaṃ yuktam /
analyzed: na ca upagama balena sapakṣa asapakṣau vyavasthāpya pramāṇa pravartanam yuktam
translated: And it is not proper to establish the similar and dissimilar instances by the power of acceptance and then engage the means of valid cognition.

analyzed: evam hi āgama siddhaḥ ātmā syāt
translated: For in this way, the self would be established by scripture.

analyzed: na anumāna siddhaḥ
translated: Not established by inference.

analyzed: tasmāt a vyatireke pi asataḥ
translated: Therefore, even if there is no difference, it is doubtful whether the non-existent

analyzed: sapakṣāt vyatirekaḥ sandigdhaḥ
translated: is excluded from the similar instance.

analyzed: syāt prāṇa ādīnām
translated: It would be doubtful whether life, etc.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ sandehāt
translated: are excluded from the non-self, because the self is doubtful.

original: ata eva vipakṣād api /🔽ekatra hi niyame siddhe 'nyanivartanaṃ
analyzed: atas eva vipakṣāt api  ekatra hi niyame siddhe
translated: For this very reason, it is also doubtful whether [life, etc.] are excluded from the dissimilar instance.

original: sidhyet / anyathā kvacid dṛṣṭe 'bhāvasidhāv api syād evādṛṣṭe saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: sidhyet anyathā kvacid dṛṣṭe bhāva sidhau api syāt eva adṛṣṭe saṃśayaḥ
translated: For, when it is established that [life, etc.] are restricted to one [category], the exclusion from the other is established. Otherwise, even if the non-existence is established when [life, etc.] are seen somewhere, there would still be doubt when they are not seen.

original: tathā hy asakalavyaktibhedavyāpino 'py arthāḥ kecit tajjātisaṃbhavino dṛṣṭāḥ pārthivālohalekhyavat /
analyzed: tathā hi a sakala vyakti bheda vyāpinaḥ pi arthāḥ kecid tad jāti saṃbhavinaḥ dṛṣṭāḥ pārthiva āloha lekhya vat
translated: For indeed, some objects, although pervading the individual differences of the whole, are seen to be possible in that class, like earth and iron in writing.

analyzed: virodhasya ca adṛṣṭeḥ saṃdeha
translated: And because there is no seen contradiction, there is only doubt.

analyzed: eva nairātmyena prāṇa ādīnām ukta lakṣaṇasya virodhasya asiddheḥ
translated: Because the contradiction of the life, etc. with non-self, which has the characteristics stated, is not established.

analyzed: sandigdhaḥ nairātmyāt vyatirekaḥ
translated: The exclusion from non-self is doubtful.

original: ātmapratiniyame hi tatkāryātmatayā prāṇādīnāṃ nairātmyena saha virodhaḥ
analyzed: ātma pratiniyame hi tad kārya ātmatayā prāṇa ādīnām nairātmyena saha virodhaḥ
translated: For, if [life, etc.] were restricted to the self, there would be a contradiction of the life, etc. with non-self by their being the effect of the self.

original: syāt / sa ca na sidhyatīty uktam /
analyzed: syāt sa ca na sidhyati iti uktam
translated: And that is not established, as stated.

original: astu nāma nirātmakebhyo vyatirekaḥ prāṇādīnāṃ tadbhāve ca nairātmyavyāvṛttiḥ /
analyzed: astu nāma nirātmakebhyaḥ vyatirekaḥ prāṇa ādīnām tad bhāve ca nairātmya vyāvṛttiḥ
translated: Let it be that there is an exclusion of the life, etc. from the non-self, and that when they exist, there is an exclusion of non-self.

analyzed: tathā api na anairātmyāt ātmā jīvat śarīre sidhyati
translated: Even so, the self is not established in the living body from the exclusion of non-self.

analyzed: yena ayam na vyatirekasya abhāvam
translated: By which [reasoning] he does not accept the absence of the vyatireka

analyzed: bhāvam icchati
translated: as the existence [of the vyatireka].

analyzed: yathā vyatireka abhave sa pakṣe prāṇa ādiḥ na iṣṭaḥ
translated: Just as prāṇa and so on are not accepted as the sapakṣa even when the vyatireka is not possible.

analyzed: sapakṣa avyatirekī ced hetuḥ hetuḥ atas nvayī
translated: If the reason is not different from the sapakṣa, then the reason is the anvaya.

analyzed: na anvaya vyatirekī ced anairātmyam na sātmakam
translated: If it is not the anvaya and vyatireka, then non-self is not with self.

analyzed: iti saṃgraha ślokaḥ
translated: This is the summary verse.

analyzed: na prāṇa ādi saṃbhavena nairātmya vyāvartanāt ātma gati
translated: Not by the possibility of prāṇa and so on, nor by the reversal of non-self, is there the attainment of self.🔽Then what? Prāṇa and so on are

analyzed: kim tarhi vidhi mukhena eva prāṇa ādayaḥ
translated: by the method of injunction alone.
